Thanks, Jim.  That explains why I couldn't find it.  I don't own that particular book.  Am I correct in thinking the depressions are supposed to be deer tracks? 

David Zincavage
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Jim Gilbert 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, July 22, 2005 3:18 PM
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] book identification


  It's from Tsuba Nyumon by Shibata Mitsuo.

  That type of guard is a fairly common subset of Heianjo-zogan.  The deeply worked plate with inlay running over the concavities, the style of inlay and the shape of the kogai-ana are the distinctive features.  Yoshiro is an unusual attribution.

  Jim



    Does anyone recognize the book this photo comes from?  The format is very similar to Tsuba no Bi, but it's not in my copy.   



    http://zincavage.org/Unknownbook.html
